website_summaries.verdict: Logitech's first stab at an iOS game controller nails design and feel, but lacks flexibility or extra features.
pros: The Logitech Powershell feels sturdy, its buttons are solid and responsive, and an included battery can recharge an iPhone or iPod Touch
cons: Too expensive, doesn't show battery-recharge status clearly, and lacks the analog sticks and extra triggers of competing controllers

customer_reviews.title: Great for about two months, then it dies
customer_reviews.text: I've just gone though my second one of these. Both of which lasted about two months of use on a daily basis for less than an hour a day. They both just stopped working. Nothing dramatic, just all of a sudden the phone just stopped recognizing that it was there. Other than the short life span, it's a great product for me. I primarily play snes and gba games though an emulator on my 5s, so the d-pad control is great for me. I would probably buy another, however it doesn't look like they're available for Prime anymore. Five stars if I didn't have to buy a new one every two months.
customer_reviews.author: Sean R. Wood

customer_reviews.title: At this price this is a great item for anyone who games on iPhone or just ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mom for her birthday. She loves her iPhone but cant really play games on the small screen so this lets her play her games (that this works with) without fumbling the buttons. My boys play terriera on her phone with it and say they need one for their phones. they don't have iphones so I don't know how that would work. At this price this is a great item for anyone who games on iPhone or just to mess with
customer_reviews.author: Laci

customer_reviews.title: At many games The D-Pad is almost useless you have to press all the way and with ...
customer_reviews.text: Cons: At many games The D-Pad is almost useless you have to press all the way and with immense pressure for it to work. (which is a major drawback it not a deal killer). Pros: Bought it on a huge discount, for a dirt-cheap $8.99 Build quality is top Additional power-bank is nice addition Good protection shell My son likes it NOTE: It is being used with an iPhone SE
customer_reviews.author: Abdalkarem Al Abawi

customer_reviews.title: well worth
customer_reviews.text: This is so worth the price but has some downsides to it. First the battery dies within a few so you can't get a full charge on your phone and lastly not very many apps are optimised for this controller. Other then that is is very thin and very responsive and I got mine for less then 10 bucks so 4 stars only because battery life is a pain
customer_reviews.author: AB23col

customer_reviews.title: Now that the price is reduced it's a cool gadget for kids with an iPod Touch
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for my son as a christmas present. He uses it all the time. The fact that it charges his iPod touch is great! I know that it has limited game functionality which is why the price has gone down so much since launch. Considering where the price is at currently It's a great device for a kid.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Bansley

customer_reviews.title: JUNK DON’T BUY
customer_reviews.text: Junk don’t waste your money on this the battery doesn’t stay charged for long and after a few days of use it’s already malfunctioning
customer_reviews.author: Dark_Charizard_31

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this! I was debating on getting a portable gaming system when a friend of mine told me to find a controller for my iPhone. This one is totally awesome! Also I love how it's also an extra battery! My only issue is not with the controller itself, it's just I wish the Apple store had a way of telling me which games would work with these types of controllers.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer J Gunn

customer_reviews.title: But it is a lot better than using a non connected gamepad on a phone ...
customer_reviews.text: It has a battery and gives you real buttons and d-pad to enhance gameplay. It is too big though to leave on so it is not something you would be carrying around usually. The audio jack needs some adapter to be accessed so that is a negative. Unfortunately most games are just not really gamepad native so it does not get a lot use. But it is a lot better than using a non connected gamepad on a phone because you don't need to prop up the phone.
customer_reviews.author: Monte Jeu

customer_reviews.title: Very nice iPhone case + Battery-extender
customer_reviews.text: As already mentioned by other reviewers, not a lot of games/apps support the joystick/controller functions. As such, I don't believe this to be the fault of the manufacturer or this product itself as most games/apps are indeed designed only for the iPhone's touch screen. The saving grace, though, and the reason why I'm giving this a high 4 stars is because of the battery function and the very well-made design and over-all quality of this product. In other words, it's a very nice case-- giving my old iPhone 5 newfound life as a portable gaming-console-like feel and it doubles the iPhone's battery which is a perfect boredom killer for my son.
customer_reviews.author: Jun A.

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Most of the iOS controller games don't seem to recognize it. Out of the 10 I've tried, only one works minimally. I'm going to continue to see if we can find games that work but so far, not so much. On the one game that worked, the buttons were not very responsive. I really expected more from Logitech. That is usually a name I trust when purchasing accessories.
customer_reviews.author: SuzInKS

customer_reviews.title: Decent controller for the iPhone 5s. Needs analog
customer_reviews.text: For the price, can't beat it. I needed to play my GTA games on the iPhone 5s. This works with all the GTA's as well as Star Wars Kotor. Buttons are rather stiff, and the D-pad is not analog. The huge downfall is the missing analog and not worth the original asking price. But for $6, you can't lose. You can also use it as a backup charger.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew M.

customer_reviews.title: The shell doesn't use a lightning connector to charge, ...
customer_reviews.text: The shell doesn't use a lightning connector to charge, so you have to have a different charger available when charging it; you can't use your iPhone charger. The power switch makes it hard to tell if the device is off or on, and the power switch pass through for the iPhone is extremely difficult to use.
customer_reviews.author: DracheMitch

customer_reviews.title: Not Sure
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a gift for my niece and she never used it. I asked her a few months afterwards if it worked well/she liked it and she said she lost it without never even opening it. Awesome. Gave it 5 stars on assumption.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Cory

customer_reviews.title: Terrible d pad
customer_reviews.text: The d pad is absolutely horrible. It simply just does not register presses without pushing hard. Down gets triggered half the time I use the right button. I wrote quick app to test how the pad reacts, and was able to confirm that it does not start to register until you have pressed quite firmly.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Costa

customer_reviews.title: 3 stars is all it needs
customer_reviews.text: i would have thought i was getting something awesome but in the end it was an <okay> thing, it wasnt as cool as i thought, the buttons, you need to push hard on it to work, most games on it is okay but sometimes you need more buttons for the games to feel awesome, like GTA san Andreas it needs more buttons for it, a good game that requires it and is a must is "the wolf among us, " that game is the only game i use the product, but over all its an okay product.
customer_reviews.author: Adalid Cuevas

customer_reviews.title: The d-pad and the face buttons
customer_reviews.text: I like the powershell controller. It's really nice and fits my needs. However I only have two complaints: the d-pad and the face buttons. The d-pad is bad because I have to push really hard to get it to register. That gets annoying, especially when the games I play don't have analog control. The face buttons are bad because they are a little too small to fit me. They work great, it's just that they're too small. If they were any bigger they would be perfect. Those are my two complaints, other than that, the controller works great and I would recommend it to my friends
customer_reviews.author: Logan Hall

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I bought this device for my 11 year old son. The Logitech Powershell feels sturdy, its buttons are solid and responsive, and an included battery can recharge an iPhone or iPod Touch. This product does what I bought it for.
customer_reviews.author: Mom to Be

customer_reviews.title: d-pad pretty lackluster
customer_reviews.text: every button feels great, but the unresponsive d-pad really offsets the product's viability
customer_reviews.author: Sachiko Miller

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable to hold nice design, but lacks in joy sticks, the d pad is very hard to press and not very responsive either. Once your phone is in, it seems like you have to fidget with the connection because the device has trouble connecting the device. If you are looking for a cheap quick way to inhale your gaming this is a good buy, but I recommend waiting and saving your money for a better qu and more recent controller. This controller says it is compatible with iOS 7 which is pretty outdated now.
customer_reviews.author: carlos zaizar

customer_reviews.title: Changes the game for gamers!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son for Christmas and it was a big hit!! He is 11, he uses it for his iPod 5 and it’s definitely worth it!! I would purchase again if needed!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product for its price!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product for $10! The d pad kind of sucks but I'm very pleased with the whole product just for $10. The buttons aren't as responsive as you may like, but they get the job done. Although mine may be defective because the blue indicator light doesn't come on when it's charging. But I know it charges because it charges my phone! However it will blink red when it dies. But over all I would recommend this product for how cheap it is! I'd say it's worth about $20-25. But getting it for $10 is just great! Hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: Carson

customer_reviews.title: This is a great controller with a few minr flaws
customer_reviews.text: This is a great controller with a few minr flaws. First of all, I really like the idea of a controller, but the buttons can be somewhat hard to push at times or don't respond as they should. The second this I noticed is that not all applications work with this controller, which is unfortunate.
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: It works with iphone 5c.
customer_reviews.text: The Powershell works fine . My iphone 5c Fits a little snug do to its plastic case . The games work fine the pad can be a bit unresponsive. But for an 8 dollar gadget I can't complain.
customer_reviews.author: askmrhp

customer_reviews.title: Shipped quickly to Hawaii and came undamaged Product was easy to use and get a feel of using
customer_reviews.text: Shipped quickly to Hawaii and came undamaged Product was easy to use and get a feel of using... only complain is the movement control felt bit stiff but as you get use to it gets easier.
customer_reviews.author: $crillas

customer_reviews.title: Such a cool tech! I get a lot of people turning ...
customer_reviews.text: Works excellently with! Such a cool tech! I get a lot of people turning their heads saying what is that??? or is that your phone case??? with my phone in this case is I'm minimally using my phone the battery lasts three days! Awesome with GTA and Goblin Sword. The only thing that I would change is to make it chargeable with the apple brand charger and not the micro usb thingy which is kinda finicky.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works great, no problems
customer_reviews.text: My son got this for his 5S. It fits perfectly, no issues with the d-pad like some have mentioned. He told me I had to give it a 5 star review because he's so happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy J

customer_reviews.title: Product is great!! Quality is amazing
customer_reviews.text: Product is great!! Quality is amazing!! This can be a power bank too if you flip a switch!! Games that work well are Sonic CD, Reel Steel and many more! I am so glad that it has a hole for a headphone jack! The only flaw is that it wont fit in your pocket. Dont trust the other reviews that say this is bad. It is also rechargable and doesn't need Bluetooth. I would totally recomend if you hate playing games by tapping a piece of glass the entire time!
customer_reviews.author: Rosario F.

customer_reviews.title: Ouch
customer_reviews.text: Did not get it to work as it was described in the add. Tried several times to connect and when I finally got it to work only one or two of the buttons worked. It's in the trash as a "don't by this kind of stuff online" lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but not the greatest
customer_reviews.text: I'll be honest this is a product that technically "does what it's supposed to do", but after about 15 minutes into playing a game on my phone I didn't feel comfortable using it. The button sensitivity was a little off, strange because the device is directly connected to it. The L and R triggers just aren't there yet too. All of this is me, and I have to say it does do what it's made for but its just not up to par for me. Great price though! Its defiantly worth it if you aren't looking for a top notch gaming controller.
customer_reviews.author: Dimitrius P.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great price, good looking, and sturdy. The only problems are the power button that does not quite fit and putting the iPod5 in and taking it out. Not sure if it would fit better an iPhone 5.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Completely satisfied with my purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. Quality product at affordable price. Exactly as mention in product details. So happy with this purchase and this seller. Will do business again.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: 11 yr old approves
customer_reviews.text: My son really likes this. Took him a little bit to figure out the controls, but once he got the hang of it he really loves it. Only drawback for kids is you have to take the iPod out of its protective case to put it in this controller case- so fingers crossed he doesn't drop it!
customer_reviews.author: Southern Mom of 2

customer_reviews.title: Works great on an iPod 5th gen
customer_reviews.text: Works great on an iPod 5th gen. Buttons and everything work awesome. My only gripe is that there is no analog stick. Really pleased with this controller overall though. Does what it is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Weasley's Weezer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product.
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I was really looking forward to using this. Works as intended. Battery is a little short. It will power your phone for about 75% charge. Buttons are the most responsive and sometimes have to give them a press over a light tap. But its to be expected. Don't buy this if you think its going to feel like a gameboy or xbox controller. Its a casual controller.
customer_reviews.author: John Ayers

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product.
customer_reviews.text: After reading some reviews I was leery about receiving this product. Once it arrived I tried it out in my son's ipod 5 and WOW. It works amazing you just have to find games that requires the use of a controller. I'm gonna buy a second one so we can play games together. Love the value and quality of it. Pretty cool it even acts as a backup battery.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Needs more adoption
customer_reviews.text: Great quality; however, not many apps that support it. Would give 5 stars if more apps supported it.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Brinkley

customer_reviews.title: Very nice concept though
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work on most of anything. The games it should work on doesn't either. Maybe the game makers don't include it in their updates. Very nice concept though. Would have been great if it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: its ok
customer_reviews.text: this controller is ok. the amount of games that support it is very small and the d-pad and buttons could use some work. the buttons and d-pad are analog meaning that it can sense how hard your pressing. the problem comes with the fact that most games use digital inputs so you have to press the buttons harder than you would think for it to register. after a while you will get used to it but it is still a problem. its good for the current price however
customer_reviews.author: iansmartjr

customer_reviews.title: I have a sense that it could have been better but it's

Also the other buttons would stick. I loved the feel of the controller but I decided on returning it because I need it to work.

customer_reviews.title: Very strong and can take a beating.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Son years ago and it still works. He drops everything and is very rough on electronics. This thing is very tough and is still taking his abuse.

customer_reviews.title: Basically turns your iPhone into a PSP
customer_reviews.text: Great product. You have to charge it right out of the box. I've tested the controller with Assassins Creed, GTA SA, Sonic 2 and Real Racing 3 on the iPhone SE and it works great!

customer_reviews.title: A little pricey but worth it if you use it
customer_reviews.text: This controller is great and there are a large amount of games that have Incorporated this controller into their apps.(not flapyy bird) My only complaint, the D pad is a little hard to use at times. out of the 8 directions, it seems like the diagonals take up more space making it hard to just go one direction on the d-pad. Other than that, this controller is amazing. Great battery life, charges your phone, not bulky but very useful and it fits it most guy-pockets. If they gave it a joystick of sorts, I would have rated it 5/5

customer_reviews.title: ... for weeks now and has told me it works great!

customer_reviews.title: YES
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I was looking for. With support for GTA: San Andreas, I can finally complete missions that were nearly impossible using just the touch screen! I will admit that the response rate of the controls are not perfect, but for now I would consider this to be the best controller out having tried other options that are far worse. :]

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I like it just as much as any normal game controller.

customer_reviews.title: Best for price
customer_reviews.text: Pros: It's great for its price, and it works well with GBA4iOS. Cons: The buttons are slightly unresponsive. Overall, it works well, especially for $8. I would be fine with a somewhat more expensive version with higher quality buttons, however.

customer_reviews.text: after a month the lightning connector stopped working, i emailed logitech and haven't recieved a response and that was a week ago, went with the moga ace power and am much happier
customer_reviews.author: Derek May

customer_reviews.title: Good controller, depending on the game.
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad controller overall, battery life seems a bit on the short side, but the controls themselves are good. I primarily bought this to play World of Tanks Blitz because I'm terrible with on-screen touch controls. It works well in that regard, but of course aiming the gun still requires swiping the screen as it doesn't have a right thumbstick. On a pure platformer like Limbo it is excellent. One downside is that I often forget to take out the headphone adapter before removing the phone from the case, which I'm sure is a quick path to breakage; that hasn't happened yet, but it is something to keep in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Lowery

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: it seems to work but very small variety of games are compatible with.
customer_reviews.author: Jhonny

customer_reviews.title: may be cheap, but not worth it
customer_reviews.text: First, to answer some questions. Yes, it does work on iOS9 and on an ipod touch 6thgen, though there are only some apps that actually seem to work with it. The controller feel is nice, I really wish it was worth keeping. The directional pad is garbage though. I saw other comments, but I decided to try it anyway. Ended up returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Se7en

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: D-Pad is a little sketchy but the buttons are nice and the build of the actual controller is sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Nico

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Don't work it says it charges your phone but only when it's plugged in
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Logitech PowerShell Controller with Battery for iPhone 5/5S and iPod Touch 5th Generation - Black
product_meta.description:
A combination mobile game controller and second battery, Logitech PowerShell Controller + Battery lets you play and talk and surf and shoot and play some more. Console-style analog game controls allow for more intensive, complex game play with an entire screen for viewing. A 1500 mAh battery provides for long play sessions.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


It's easy to be passionate about winning, but at Logitech, our passion is in the science that makes winning possible. We build precise gaming instruments. We advance technology so gamers can reach new levels of speed, precision, reliability and comfort. Science is our philosophy, our methodology for studying, testing, and advancing gamers' experience—in the lab and in the game.

Learn more about Logitech G science.

FEATURES
view larger LOGITECH POWERSHELL CONTROLLER + BATTERY 
POWER YOUR GAME. POWER YOUR IPHONE. 
Logitech PowerShell Controller + Battery gives you powerful, precise console-style game controls for iOS 7 while increasing your battery capacity. Load up your favorite games and play longer and stronger with a clear view of the entire screen. It's a more intense mobile gaming experience, without your fingers in the way.

PRODUCT HIGHLIGHTS
 * Console-style analog controls
 * Advanced battery for uninterrupted gaming
 * Supports iOS 7 controller-compatible games
 * Slim profile fits in pocket for immersive gaming on the go
 * Comfortable rubber grip
 * Allows full access to phone features during gaming
 * Works with iPhone 5, iPhone 5s or 5th generation iPod touch

view larger CONSOLE-STYLE CONTROLS
 *  Powerful, precise console-style analog controls—dominate your favorite iOS games more easily than using on-screen controls
 * D-pad, shoulder triggers and button cluster move your hands away from the screen for the clearest view of the action

INTEGRATED 1500 MAH BATTERY 
 *  Increases the available power capacity of iPhone 5, iPhone 5s or 5th generation iPod touch 
 * Allows immersive, intense gaming without straining your device's battery
 * No surpises—external battery indicator shows you when power is low
 * Micro-USB cable included for easy charging of both your device and PowerShell

view larger MADE FOR IOS 7 GAMES
 *  Play groundbreaking new games and timeless classics—you’re not limited to a small selection of games targeted at one controller
 * Take full advantage of iOS 7 and PowerShell's analog console-style controls
 * No extra software to install—just download a favorite game and go
 * Check the App Store frequently for the latest controller-compatible game releases such as Bastion, LEGO The Lord of the Rings, LIMBO, Sonic the Hedgehog 2, Star Wars Knights of the Old Republic, Terraria, King of Fighters i 2012, The Wolf Among Us, Tomb Raider, Trials Xtreme 3, Scribblenaut Remix, PAC-MAN 

view larger SLIM PROFILE FOR QUICK-DRAW GAMING 
 *  Lightweight, streamlined shape goes with you anywhere
 * Fits easily into your pocket, bag, or backpack

view larger COMFORTABLE GAMING GRIP 
 Contoured curves and a subtly textured soft rubber surface offer a sure—and comfortable—grip for hours of gaming.

view larger EASILY ACCESS PHONE FEATURES
 *  PowerShell adds great gaming features without stopping you from snapping pictures, making calls, or listening to music
 * Your device’s volume up/down buttons, ring/silent switch, and power/sleep button also remain fully accessible


COMPATIBILITY
WHAT'S IN THE BOX?
 *  Controller
 * Micro-USB charging cable
 * Headphone extender
 * iPod touch adapter
 * User documentation

WHAT YOU NEED: 
iPhone 5, iPhone 5s or iPod Touch (5th generation) with iOS 7
